title: Define the Domain
text: A square root function is undefined when the expression under the square root is negative. So, let's start by setting the expression under the sqare root greater than or equal to zero. Then we know every value that makes this true is the domain of the function.

title: Answer
text: Since any integer squared is positive, and we are adding four to the squared number, there is no value of $$x$$ that makes the function undefined. So, the domain is $$(-\infty,\infty)$$.
